description.narrative: (i) The Project would support the launching of a new Energy Efficiency product through a leading microfinance institution for the benefit of low income people in Jordan to allow them to use cleaner and renewable sources of energy (solar energy). (ii) Tamweelcom would be the first MFI in Jordan to offer such an innovative product that would contribute positively to its market position. (iii) IFC will provide long term funding to enable the Company to continue supporting, and further grow its clients base. The social and economic impacts would be high especially that women borrowers represent 90% of Tamweelcom's clients. (iv) The planned AS will strengthen Tamweelcom internal capacity and enhance the loan officers skills in promoting such products. (v) Social and economic implications by lowering monthly energy bills for end-users of the solar panels.

The project entails a senior term loan to Tamweelcom, a leading microfinance institution in Jordan, to provide it with the needed financing to expand its microfinance activities and initially extend Energy Efficiency/Renewable Energy microfinance loans to its clients. The project also includes an Advisory Services package to assist Tamweelcom in product development and roll-out, training of loan officers, and putting in place policies and procedures for the new products.

mailing-address.narrative: Mr. Ziad Al-Refai - CEO Tamweelcom Sweileh Kheir Al-Dein Al-Maiane Street P.O.Box 925715, Amman 11190 - Jordan Tel: +962-6-5354336/7/8 Fax: +962-6-5354328 ziadalrefai@tamweelcom.org www.tamweelcom.org

name.narrative: Tamweelcom is headquartered in Amman and has 17 branches covering different areas of Jordan. Investments can be made throughout the Country.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

sector.narrative: HA - Microfinance and Small Business - Non Commercial Banking
